cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi (180 km) south-southwest of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight across the Cayman Islands and western Cuba, then accelerating across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cayman Islands; western Cuba (Matanzas westward); Isle of Youth
weather_observation.warning_coast: same as watch area (Cayman Islands and western Cuba)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward to Alabama/Florida line (highest risk Louisiana/Mississippi coast)
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained 25–35 kt (30–40 mph) winds with higher gusts late Sunday into Monday should the storm track shift west or expand in size; current probability for TS-force winds is 35%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible on the upper Texas coast due to long-period swell and onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain to Galveston Sunday night through Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas beginning this weekend could impact vessel traffic and berth operations.
